com.RecSys.Recommender

Class RatingAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.RecSys.Recommender.RatingAlgorithm

  • public class RatingAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains different algorithms to derive implicit ratings. They are all called by a method in ProcessData.java (convertToRatings) Algorithm 2 and 3 were just experiments. We did not use them in the end. The most important algorithm is algorithm 4 which is divied into three steps that are called in method convertToRatingsStudyByChoiEtAl in ProcessData.java.

      static float algorithm3(int clicks, int buys, int amountClicksBuys) 
      static double algorithm4Step1(int buys, int totalUserBuys)
      This method implements the CF-algorithm of following paper: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S156742231200018X# Modification: Also clicks are regarded
      static double algorithm4Step2(double absolutePreference, double maximumPreference)
      Preference for buys will be between 3 and 5.
      static double algorithm4Step3(int clicks)
      Preference for clicks only will be either 1 or 2

      • algorithm3

                               int buys,
                               int amountClicksBuys)

      • algorithm4Step1

        public static double algorithm4Step1(int buys,
                                     int totalUserBuys)
        This method implements the CF-algorithm of following paper: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S156742231200018X# Modification: Also clicks are regarded
        Parameters:
        buys - Amount of buys of the current user of the current product
        totalUserBuys - total amount of buys of the user

      • algorithm4Step2

        public static double algorithm4Step2(double absolutePreference,
                                     double maximumPreference)
        Preference for buys will be between 3 and 5. See paper http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S156742231200018X#
        Parameters:
        absolutePreference - The preference of the current user for the current product
        maximumPreference - The maximum preference that any user had for the current product

      • algorithm4Step3

        public static double algorithm4Step3(int clicks)
        Preference for clicks only will be either 1 or 2
        Parameters:
        clicks - Total clicks on product by current user
